meanings.definition: The act of broadcasting live or pre-recorded audio or video content over the internet.
meanings.sent1: Webcasting allows people to watch events online in real-time.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy webcasting my podcast episodes to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally started webcasting its meowing on the internet.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the webcasting world, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The webcasting of the concert made me feel like I was right there in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A method of transmitting media content over the World Wide Web.
meanings.sent1: Webcasting has made it easier to share videos with friends online.
meanings.sent2: The company uses webcasting to showcase their latest products to customers.
meanings.sent3: The webcasting of the cooking show accidentally included the chef's bloopers.
meanings.sent4: His ideas flowed seamlessly through the webcasting platform, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The webcasting of breaking news kept viewers informed and engaged.
